AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.large white Ford pickup truck: vehicle involved in the stop by United States/Mexican Border Patrol, suspected of being a lead car, with equipment including tool boxes, a spare gas tank, and an air tank in its bed, bearing a Kansas license plate, exhibited unusual driving behavior near Marathon, Texas, and was stopped 70 or 80 miles from the United States/Mexican Border, containing two unloaded handguns, subject of a motion to suppress evidence, driven by Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot, traveled through an area very close to the United States/Mexican Border prior to the stop, with proximity to the border being a factor in the stop, and was seen leaving Big Bend National Park early on a Sunday morning, deviating from typical traffic patterns, raising suspicion due to its unusual departure time, slowed dramatically to fifteen miles per hour below the speed limit, remained stopped at a stop sign for five seconds, made an unusual turn and traveled toward Alpine, Texas on Highway 118, displayed indirect travel route from Big Bend National Park to Alpine, Texas, did not have a park sticker on its windshield, stopped seventy-five miles from the United States/Mexican Border Patrol
